title: 'Cheating husband' sues Uber for tipping off wife
text:
'Cheating husband' sues Uber for tipping off wife Web Report   
(AFP) The business is reportedly suing the company for a whopping Dh176 million. A man in France is suing Uber after his wife discovered that he was cheating on her, using the app. According to reports, the wife was able to track her husband's rides to see his lover, after he once requested an Uber driver from her phone. Based in Southern France, the businessman is reportedly suing the ride-hailing company for up to $48 million (Dh176 million). Despite logging off, the application continued to send notifications to her iPhone afterwards, revealing his travel history and arousing her suspicions. The couple have since divorced. "My client was the victim of a bug in an application," his lawyer David-André Darmon told AFP news agency after the case was lodged at a court in Grasse. Also read: Wife catches 'cheating husband' using iPhone app "The bug has caused him problems in his private life," Darmon added. The lawyer declined to comment on a report in French daily, Le Figaro, that the lawsuit was worth up to $48m, adding that his client wished to remain discreet and anonymous. Other user have also encountered the Uber software bug, the French daily added. The glitch affected iPhones before a software update in December. Android phones did not appear to be affected. Declining to comment on the case, Uber added that the best possible protection of clients' personal details was a priority. Share
